headline: Teledyne CEO retires, insider Bobb to take over
summary: Bobb, who has been president and chief operating officer since January 1 last year, previously headed the company's aerospace and defense electronics segment and its engineered systems segment, among others.  "George and I will continue the development and execution of Teledyne's growth strategy, with George reporting directly to me," Teledyne's Executive Chairman Robert Mehrabian said.

content.title: Teledyne CEO retires, insider Bobb to take over
content.summary: Bobb, who has been president and chief operating officer since January 1 last year, previously headed the company's aerospace and defense electronics segment and its engineered systems segment, among others.  "George and I will continue the development and execution of Teledyne's growth strategy, with George reporting directly to me," Teledyne's Executive Chairman Robert Mehrabian said.

headline: Teledyne Appoints George Bobb as Chief Executive Officer
summary: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif., April 28, 2025--Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (NYSE:TDY) ("Teledyne") announced today that Teledyne’s Board of Directors named George C. Bobb III as Teledyne’s President and Chief Executive Officer, effective immediately. Simultaneously, Edwin Roks has retired as Teledyne’s Chief Executive Officer, but will continue as a special advisor to Robert Mehrabian, Executive Chairman, through August 31, 2025.

content.title: Teledyne Appoints George Bobb as Chief Executive Officer
content.summary: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif., April 28, 2025--Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (NYSE:TDY) ("Teledyne") announced today that Teledyne’s Board of Directors named George C. Bobb III as Teledyne’s President and Chief Executive Officer, effective immediately. Simultaneously, Edwin Roks has retired as Teledyne’s Chief Executive Officer, but will continue as a special advisor to Robert Mehrabian, Executive Chairman, through August 31, 2025.

headline: 3 Dawdling Stocks with Mounting Challenges
summary: Stability is great, but low-volatility stocks may struggle to deliver market-beating returns over time as they sometimes underperform during bull markets.

content.title: 3 Dawdling Stocks with Mounting Challenges

headline: Recoverable Loitering Munitions Are More Cost- and Mission-Effective Than One-Way Attack Drones, Says New Teledyne FLIR Defense Whitepaper
summary: WASHINGTON, April 28, 2025--In a new whitepaper, Teledyne FLIR Defense, part of Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (NYSE:TDY), says that emerging cost-effective precision strike solutions that can be safely recovered and reused offer a strong alternative to more commonly deployed ‘One-Way Attack’ or First Person View (FPV) drones.

content.title: Recoverable Loitering Munitions Are More Cost- and Mission-Effective Than One-Way Attack Drones, Says New Teledyne FLIR Defense Whitepaper
content.summary: WASHINGTON, April 28, 2025--In a new whitepaper, Teledyne FLIR Defense, part of Teledyne Technologies Incorporated (NYSE:TDY), says that emerging cost-effective precision strike solutions that can be safely recovered and reused offer a strong alternative to more commonly deployed ‘One-Way Attack’ or First Person View (FPV) drones.

thumbnail.caption: In a new whitepaper, 'USE IT, DON’T LOSE IT: The Case for Recoverable and Reusable Loitering Munitions,' Teledyne FLIR Defense argues that precision strike solutions which can be safely recovered and reused are more cost- and mission-effective than ‘One-Way Attack’ or First Person View (FPV) drones. Reusable lethal UAS are better suited to support operations in the ‘atmospheric littoral,’ the very low-altitude airspace (up to several hundred feet above ground level) which, if controlled, can significantly enhance ground maneuver of combat units.
